intro: Scilla bisotunensis, commonly known as the Bisotun scilla, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its bulbs are perennial, and it blooms in early spring, making it a notable species in alpine flora. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic plant.
